author: Ella Lee
description: A federal appeals court on Friday rejected President Trump’s assertion that emergency powers justify his worldwide tariffs, a blow to his efforts to refashion global trade.  In a 7-4 decision, the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit affirmed a lower court’s ruling that the tariffs were not authorized by the statute Trump cited…
title: Federal appeals court rejects Trump’s emergency tariffs

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The state of Florida could lose $218 million after a judge ordered the closure of Alligator Alcatraz, a detention facility based in the Everglades that was once a training airport. The site was created with funding from the Florida Division of Emergency Management and was quickly retrofitted to house people detained for federal immigration purposes. …
title: Alligator Alcatraz conversion could cost Florida $218M

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: FTC Chairman Andrew N. Ferguson has warned Gmail that it may face a federal investigation over allegations that it intentionally suppresses messages sent by Republicans, which could violate the FTC Act's prohibition of unfair or deceptive trade practices.
title: FTC chair alleges Gmail uses partisan filtering

author: Joseph Choi
description: Related video: Changes Atop the CDC CVS Health does not currently plan to offer the updated annual vaccine COVID-19 vaccine in more than a dozen states, citing the current “regulatory environment” after the updated shots receiving approval for high risk groups this week. A spokesperson for CVS said in a statement that “based on the…
title: CVS withholding COVID vaccines in 15 states and DC, citing ‘regulatory environment’

author: Lexi Lonas Cochran
description: Arlington Public Schools and Fairfax County Public Schools sued the Department of Education on Friday after the federal agency threatened funding losses over the Virginia school districts’ policies regarding transgender students.   The Education Department said five school districts in Northern Virginia were at risk of losing funding over their refusal to change policies that…
title: School districts sue Education Department over transgender policy funding loss threats

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: A federal appeals court has blocked the Trump administration from ending protections from deportation for some 600,000 Venezuelans living in the U.S. The decision from a three-judge panel for the 9th Circuit Court of Appeals reinstalls Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for Venezuelans in the U.S., which were lifted by the Supreme Court despite a lower…
title: Court blocks Trump administration from ending deportation protections for Venezuelans in US

author: Sarah Curmi, opinion contributor
description: State legislatures are where policy is made, where democracy is shaped, and where the fight for power is unfolding right now.
title: Democrats are winning where the party isn’t looking

author: Taylor Delandro
description: More than 26,000 packages of AquaStar cocktail shrimp sold at Walmart are impacted by this recall.
title: FDA recalls more shrimp due to radioactive threat

author: Ryan Greenstein, opinion contributor
description: Rep. Chip Roy's decision to leave Congress to run for Texas Attorney General is part of a growing trend of attorneys general being used as a pipeline to higher office for aspirational members of Congress.
title: Chip Roy’s departure highlights a growing trend for Congress

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: House Democrats are asking the National Archives And Records Administration (NARA) to open an investigation into the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) after it told a watchdog group that it was no longer retaining text messages when the nonprofit sought communications about immigration enforcement in Los Angeles. The letter to Marco Rubio, who is currently…
title: Homeland Dems demand investigation into DHS’ potential ‘unlawful destruction’ of records

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee are launching a probe into Michael Boulos, the son-in-law of President Trump, following reports he and his cousin brokered a deal with a Saudi businessman to provide the appearance of access to the Trump family. A spokesman for Boulos previously denied reporting from The New York Times that found Boulos, through…
title: Democrats launch probe into Trump son-in-law over alleged wedding deal

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) defended the Trump administration's use of National Guard troops to fight crime in major cities, but was noncommittal when asked if the National Guard should be deployed in Shreveport, La.
title: Johnson pressed on whether National Guard should be sent to his Louisiana district

author: Justin Ángel Knighten, opinion contributor
description: Twenty years after Hurricane Katrina, the U.S. is entering another dangerous season with a weakened national emergency response system, and without strong communication, trust will collapse and aid will be ineffective.
title: 20 years after Katrina, disaster communication is in crisis

author: Filip Timotija
description: Tech billionaire Elon Musk is seeking to dismiss a Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) lawsuit claiming he waited too long to disclose his growing share in Twitter, the social platform now called X.  “The SEC’s allegations, even accepted as true, make clear that Mr. Musk allegedly late-filed a single beneficial ownership form by a matter…
title: Musk seeks SEC lawsuit dismissal over Twitter stake disclosure

author: Caroline Vakil
description: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott (R) signed into law a new House map on Friday that’s expected to give Republicans five additional pick-up opportunities ahead of 2026, delivering the GOP a major win before the midterms while opponents challenge it in court. “This is Gov. Greg Abbott. I’m about to sign the law that creates the…
title: Abbott signs GOP’s redrawn Texas map

author: Marc L. Busch and Jennifer Hillman, opinion contributors
description: The Court of Appeals and the Supreme Court look at a case like this through different lenses.
title: Why two courts might see Trump’s tariffs the same way

author: Colin Meyn
description: Vice President Vance, along with a top Kremlin negotiator and a chorus of critics allied with President Trump, attacked Politico on Friday over an article about special envoy Steve Witkoff’s “struggles to manage” peace talks between Russia and Ukraine.  “This story from Politico is journalistic malpractice. But it’s more than that: it’s a foreign influence operation…
title: Vance, Putin envoy defend Witkoff from ‘warmongers’ in Politico piece

author: Michael Bartiromo
description: (NEXSTAR) – Cracker Barrel’s recent attempts to introduce a new logo didn’t go over so well with its most vocal critics, prompting the company to revert back to the old logo on Tuesday. A couple of other recent changes to the Cracker Barrel website, however, have largely gone under the radar. As reported Thursday by…
title: Cracker Barrel removes Pride and DEI pages from official website

author: Alexander Bolton
description: Senate Democratic Leader Chuck Schumer (D-N.Y.) blasted a White House budget office for advancing proposal to rescind $4.9 billion in funding allocated to the State Department and the dismantled U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), calling it “unlawful” and a rejection of bipartisanship. The Democratic leader warned it also takes Washington a step closer to…
title: Schumer blasts Trump administration for unusual ‘pocket rescission’ package

author: Aris Folley
description: Senate Appropriations Committee Chair Susan Collins (R-Maine) sounded the alarm on Friday over President Trump’s latest request to yank back congressionally approved funding, this time without Congress’ say-so, calling it an “attempt to undermine the law.” Collins said the recent request sent to Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) on Thursday seeks to pull back $4.9 billion…
title: Top Senate Republican sounds alarm over latest Trump attempt to cancel funding

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Hundreds of people are expected to protest against President Trump and for policies that benefit working families this Labor Day weekend, with demonstrations planned across the country.
title: Labor Day protests planned in DC, nationwide

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: The sudden departures of five top officials at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has rocked the public health community, with leading experts and organizations warning it may leave the United States unprepared for future outbreaks and pandemics.  In a single day, four key leaders of the CDC announced they would step down…
title: CDC tumult plunges public health world into ‘uncharted waters’

author: Eliot Wilson, opinion contributor
description: The president has always demanded unquestioning loyalty from his subordinates, not to the administration or the Constitution, but to himself and his own political fortunes.
title: In Washington, telling Trump the truth will cost you your job

author: Brett Samuels
description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Friday that White House budget director Russ Vought would oversee the “closeout” of the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), which came under intense scrutiny and has been dismantled by the Trump administration. “I joked with @POTUS that I had four jobs. He told me to give one to…
title: Vought to oversee ‘closeout’ of USAID, Rubio says

author: Corey Kvasnick, opinion contributor
description: There have been more than 390 school shootings since 1999. Until we act, we are complicit.
title: How many more children have to die before we do something to stop school shootings?

author: Filip Timotija
description: The Trump administration is weighing plans to use a Navy base near Chicago to support migrant detention efforts in the Windy City as part of the Department of Homeland Security’s (DHS) crackdown on illegal immigration. DHS asked the Naval Station Great Lakes for “limited support in the form of facilities, infrastructure, and other logistical needs…
title: White House plans to use Chicago-area Navy base for DHS crackdown

author: Dov S. Zakheim, opinion contributor
description: By now it is clear that Netanyahu and Hamas are equally cynical and equally prepared to go on fighting, whatever additional human tragedies this war will continue to create.
title: Can anything break the impasse in Gaza?

author: Filip Timotija
description: A group of top leaders who resigned from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) earlier this week cast blame for their decision on the environment created by Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and President Trump. “I think the CDC really is a place filled with great scientists and…
title: Former CDC officials point fingers at Kennedy, Trump administration amid shakeup

description: President Trump and Health and Human Services (HHS) Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. are facing pressure over the Trump administration’s decision to shakeup leadership at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). After four senior leaders resigned in the wake of CDC Director Susan Monarez’s ouster, critics question what the move means for vaccine…
title: Live updates: Trump, RFK Jr CDC questions swirl; Shutdown talks rise

author: Kara Dansky, opinion contributor
description: In 2017, there was a movement called “Me Too.” It was about taking women seriously when we complained about being sexually harassed or abused by men. Eight years later, that has all gone out the window. Women are in fact being forced to share intimate spaces like changing rooms and locker rooms with men who claim…
title: Must US and UK women be forced to change clothes in front of men?

author: Steph Whiteside
description: The change is due to the end of the "de minimis" rule, which made shipments under $800 exempt from duties and tariffs.
title: Overseas shippers pause some deliveries to US over tariff changes

author: Teddy Grant
description: Lorne Michaels, the chief of "Saturday Night Live," confirmed earlier this month there would be a cast shakeup before the upcoming season.
title: ‘SNL’ actors confirmed in and out for Season 51

author: Tara Suter
description: A man accused of throwing a sandwich at a federal law enforcement official in Washington, D.C, amid President Trump’s city takeover has been charged with misdemeanor assault. Sean Dunn, a Department of Justice (DOJ) employee at the time of the incident, was charged Wednesday with one count of “assaulting, resisting, or impeding certain officers or employees,” according to…
title: DC ‘sandwich guy’ charged with misdemeanor assault after grand jury rejects felony

author: Sarah Polus
description: A federal judge on Thursday barred the Trump administration from removing Voice of America’s (VOA) director Michael Abramowitz from his post. U.S. District Judge Royce Lamberth ruled that Kari Lake, President Trump’s top advisor to the U.S Agency for Global Media, cannot fire Abramowitz, who was told he would be “subject to termination” starting Aug. 31,…
title: Kari Lake can’t fire Voice of America director, judge says

author: Tara Suter
description: The Citizens Budget Commission (CBC), a nonpartisan think tank, argued that millionaires are crucial to funding New York City’s critical services and the city should work to retain them. “Millionaires are critical to New York’s tax base. In 2012, they comprised less than 1 percent of New York State’s and New York City’s resident filers,…
title: Nonpartisan watchdog suggests New York would benefit from more millionaires
